revised_title: Stress-Dilatancy Relation for Static Equilibrium of Particles in Contact
tldr: The author investigates the stress-dilatancy relation for static equilibrium of an assembly of particles in contact, focusing on the dilatancy and strength of the particles when subjected to a deviatoric stress system. The study establishes expressions for the relation between the rate of dilatancy and the maximum stress ratio for any ideal packing and provides insights into the behavior of particulate materials like sands, clays, sugar, and asphalt.
